newsitem.title: POLAND: JUTRZENKA ASKS KPW TO DELAY ISSUE APPROVAL.
newsitem.headline: JUTRZENKA ASKS KPW TO DELAY ISSUE APPROVAL.

text.p: Polish confectioner Jutrzenka SA has asked the Securities Commission (KPW) to suspend its deliberations on whether to approve for public trade the firm's planned one-million-share issue, Jutrzenka said on Thursday.
The company said in a statement that immediately after its shareholders meeting due on February 24 the firm would apply to the KPW to renew its deliberations.
The statement said the Capital Markets Centre of Bank Handlowy SA, which is offering the shares, acted in Jutrzenka's name, but gave no other details.
No one at the firm was immediately available for comment.
Jutrzenka had planned to issue the new common shares ex- rights to selected financial investors offering the best price.
Dutch-based Wood Securities BV had underwritten the shares, with 200,000 of them sub-underwritten by PBR .
Jutrzenka, which netted 10 million zlotys last year, seeks to transfer this year to the Warsaw bourse's main market from the parallel floor.
